com.bluegosling.streams

Interface StreamBridge<T,U>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of element produced by the stage
    U - the type of upstream element consumed by the stage
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface StreamBridge<T,U>
    A stream bridge provides a non-trivial intermediate operation, or stage, in a stream. Some kinds of operations cannot be easily modeled using a StreamOperator, so this interface is more flexible and open-ended. For example, this stage allows conversion from parallel to sequential that preserves the property of previous operations. In other words, the stages up to this one can run in parallel and then this and subsequent streams can be sequential (or vice versa). This kind of stage also allows for transformation of the encounter order (like sorting), which is not easily accomplished with a StreamOperator.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Either<Stream<T>,Spliterator<T>> bridgeFrom(Spliterator<U> source, boolean parallel)
      Accepts the given source of data and returns the results of the operation as either another stream or as a spliterator.

    • Method Detail

      • bridgeFrom

        Either<Stream<T>,Spliterator<T>> bridgeFrom(Spliterator<U> source,
                                            boolean parallel)
        Accepts the given source of data and returns the results of the operation as either another stream or as a spliterator.

        It is recommended that the returned stream or spliterator defer access to its data source. This can be accomplished by using a supplier as the backing source for the stream or spliterator.

        Parameters:
        source - the data provided by the upstream stage
        parallel - true if the source was configured to be processed in parallel
        Returns:
        the resulting data that is fed to downstream stages
